clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Chenodiol is indicated for patients with radiolucent stones in well opacifying gallbladders in whom selective surgery would be undertaken except for the presence of increased surgical risk due to systemic disease or age Chenodiol will not dissolve calcified radiopaque or radiolucent bile pigment stones

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: It acts by reducing levels of cholesterol in the bile helping gallstones that are made predominantly of cholesterol to dissolve Chenodeoxycholic acid is ineffective with stones of a high calcium or bile acid content
